title: RRB Clerk Prelims Quant (7th Dec Shift 1) #QA014

questions.text: A mixture contains milk and water in the ratio 2:1. The total quantity of the mixture is 30 liters. If x liters of water are added to the mixture, the ratio of milk to water becomes 2:3. Find the value of x.
questions.solution: Milk = $$\frac{2}{3} \times 30 = 20$$ liters. Water = 10 liters. New ratio 2:3 $$\rightarrow \frac{20}{10+x} = \frac{2}{3} \rightarrow 60 = 20 + 2x \rightarrow 2x = 40 \rightarrow x = 20$$. [cite: 4327-4340]

questions.text: P and Q started a business by investing Rs. 8,000 and Rs. 6,000 respectively. After x months, Q withdrew his investment. At the end of the year, Q's share of profit was Rs. 2,000 out of a total profit of Rs. 6,000. Find the value of x.
questions.solution: P's profit = $$6000 - 2000 = 4000$$. Ratio P:Q = 4000:2000 = 2:1. Ratio of Investment $$	imes$$ Time: $$(8000 \times 12) : (6000 \times x) = 96000 : 6000x$$. [cite_start]$$\frac{96000}{6000x} = \frac{2}{1} \rightarrow \frac{16}{x} = 2 \rightarrow x = 8$$. [cite: 4342-4360]

questions.text: The present ages of A and B are in the ratio 4:3 respectively. Three years ago, the ratio of their ages was 7:5. Find the age of A after 4 years from now (in years).
questions.solution: Present ages 4x, 3x. $$\frac{4x-3}{3x-3} = \frac{7}{5} \rightarrow 20x - 15 = 21x - 21 \rightarrow x = 6$$. [cite_start]A's present age = 24. Age after 4 years = 28. [cite: 4361-4377]

questions.text: The principal amount is Rs. 8,000, and the rate of interest is 10% per annum. If the simple interest earned is Rs. 2,000, find the time period (in years).
The downstream speed of a boat is 18 km/h, and the speed of the stream is 3 km/h. Find the time taken (in hours) by the boat to cover a distance of 30 km upstream.
questions.solution: Boat speed in still water = $$18 - 3 = 15$$ km/h. Upstream speed = $$15 - 3 = 12$$ km/h. [cite_start]Time = $$\frac{30}{12} = 2.5$$ hours. [cite: 4396-4409]

questions.text: A train of length 180 meters crosses a pole in 9 seconds. Find the time taken (in seconds) by the train to cross a bridge of length 270 meters.
questions.solution: Speed = $$\frac{180}{9} = 20$$ m/s. Total distance = $$180 + 270 = 450$$ m. [cite_start]Time = $$\frac{450}{20} = 22.5$$ seconds. [cite: 4410-4425]

questions.text: A man spends 25% of his monthly salary on rent. Out of the remaining amount, he spends 15% on clothes, and after that, he spends 20% on travelling. He saves the rest. If his savings amount to Rs. 6,120, find his monthly salary (in Rs).
A man invested Rs. P at a rate of 20% per annum compounded annually for 2 years. If the amount at the end of 2 years is Rs. 10,800, find the amount he invested (in Rs).

A shopkeeper marks up the price of an article by 40% above its cost price and allows a 10% discount on the marked price. If he earns a profit of Rs. 104 on the article, find the cost price of the article (in Rs).
questions.solution: Let CP = 100x. MP = 140x. SP after 10% discount = $$140x \times 0.9 = 126x$$. Profit = $$126x - 100x = 26x$$. $$26x = 104 \rightarrow x = 4$$. [cite_start]CP = 400. [cite: 4465-4482]

questions.text: A and B together can complete a piece of work in 12 days, and A alone can complete it in 20 days. Find the time taken (in days) by B alone to complete 60% of the work.
questions.solution: Efficiency: A+B = 5, A = 3 $$\rightarrow$$ B = 2 (Total work 60). 60% of work = 36 units. [cite_start]Time for B = $$\frac{36}{2} = 18$$ days. [cite: 4483-4497]

questions.text: Find out the wrong number: 34, 15, 15, 22.5, 45, 112.5, 337.5
questions.solution: Pattern is $$\times 0.5, \times 1, \times 1.5, \times 2...$$ Starting with 30 would fit ($$30 \times 0.5 = 15$$). [cite_start]34 is wrong. [cite: 4499-4513]

questions.text: Find out the wrong number: 56, 60, 71, 91, 131, 211, 371
questions.solution: Differences: 4, 11, 20, 40, 80, 160. Pattern should be $$5, 10, 20, 40...$$ ($$\times 2$$). [cite_start]The difference 4 and 11 are incorrect, pointing to 60 being wrong. [cite: 4514-4527]

questions.text: Find out the wrong number: 105, 108, 111, 114, 117, 120, 122
questions.solution: The series is increasing by 3. $$120 + 3 = 123$$. [cite_start]122 is wrong. [cite: 4529-4530]

questions.text: Find out the wrong number: 201, 199, 206, 190, 215, 179, 228
Find out the wrong number: 6, 12, 28, 59, 120, 241
questions.solution: Pattern: $$\times 2 + 5, \times 2 + 4, \times 2 + 3...$$ Working backwards from 241 ($$120 \times 2 + 1$$), $$59 \times 2 + 2 = 120$$, $$28 \times 2 + 3 = 59$$, $$12 \times 2 + 4 = 28$$. First term should be $$3.5$$ ($$3.5 \times 2 + 5 = 12$$). [cite_start]6 is wrong. [cite: 4530]
